reviews.sentence: Generally very pleased with hotel but breakfast selection poor. Hampton Inns staff were excellent always cheerful. The rooms were very clean and the beds really comfortable good value and location for our trip. Breakfasts were disappointing insufficient fresh fruit and pastries stale. Coffee weak and tepid.

Comfortable and Convenient. Very close to everything right of I75 so no issues with having to hunt down places to eat. Breakfast in the morning was your standard hotel fare these days but everything was fresh. The room was comfortable and clean. I would stay here again for work.

Great service and amenities. I stayed at the Hampton Inn in Lexington KY heading down to Atlanta and on the return trip as well. Such a nice hotel with really great staff. Indoor pool and gym. Complementary breakfast. Bedding was exceptional as was room layout and cleanliness. I have always had positive experiences at Hampton Inn. This one is a step above. I would definitely recommend it. Convenient too. Right off of I75 and a block from Walmart all the popular fast food places and Starbucks. Priceless.
Great room n nice customers service.

Qunite room great sleep. Very friendly staff. Bottle of water and warm cookies were offered immediately. Room was decorated nicely and it had a cozy feeling to it. Our door entry lock was broken. We had to get a gentleman from maintainece let us in the room 3 times.

Not the Usual Hilton Standard. The staff was nice. The hotel was in a convenient place. The smell that I typically get when staying at a Hilton chain was not there. It was stuffy. Bathroom needed work done on the wall where mold was.

Clean comfortable rooms and great breakfast. The location made for a perfect stop over on our family drive to Florida. The hotel beds were very comfortable and the rooms were clean. The breakfast had a nice assortment of hot and cold including fresh fruit.
My room was very modern and comfortable. Staff are very friendly and hotel had amenities I have come to expect from Hampton.
We stopped on our way to Tennessee. Very nice staff. Could use some updates in bathroom. Nice clean pool inside and friendly helpful staff. Security on site also was nice. Would def stay again.

Good Budget Choice. In the upper tier budget hotel category free wifi free hot breakfast fitness center Hampton Inns tend to be top choices. This one did not disappoint mostly. Hospitality was excellent my room was clean and comfortable the lobby and breakfast areas were bright and inviting and the breakfast was about as good as these types of properties offer. The manager on duty responded promptly to my report of a dripping faucet. Two things would made this hotel just about perfect for the business traveler. an update to the worn carpets and decor such as tired looking doors and a badly cracked lampshade in my room and prompt maintenance of equipment The small fitness center would have been nicely appointed for its size had it not been for the sign on the two out of service treadmills stating that repairs were expected to be made by May 29. this in a late July stay.
The room and hotel were great. people friendly. The AC in the room was very noisy. Other than that things were great.

Good but needs a refresh. We stayed at the Hampton for one night on our way cross country. The front desk staff were just terrific. Friendly and efficient. Our room was clean including the bathroom but the hotel and rooms look like it is been a while since they have had an update. The place was adequate but not up to the usual Hilton standards.

Wonderful staff all the way around. This was a nice hotel to stay in it needs a bit update to the decor and interior but I understand that it will be starting in November. This has been the best hotel stay on our trip by far. First of all when we checked in the gal do not remember her name was taking care of everyone very efficiently. The computer froze checking us in but she handled it was much patience. Loved her. Also we got up the next morning and went to breakfast. never had I ever been greeted so nicely taken care of if I needed something which I did not. but they were right there asking what they could do. Wonderful experience. We will Stay here again.

Unbelievably friendly staff. Very clean rooms though they do have an early 90s decor vibe. The pool was sparkling clean and an average size. The fitness center only has a few pieces of equipment and is small. The complementary breakfast actually had several quick bite options to select from. They are centrally located and budget friendly for the area a cozy no frills quiet place to stay.
Reno mess. Hotel under major Reno. Messy and ice machines not working.

Worst experience in Lexington. I came to Lexington on business this week and reserved at this Hampton for location reasons. When I arrived I saw that there were no external lights on and the facing of the hotel was missing. When I entered the hotel it was obvious that they are undergoing renovation. The website did not indicate that when I was booking prior to arrival. I knew from the hallway that the state of the room would likely not be great. It was dirty disheveled and unfit for guests to say the least. I understand that when hotels renovate they have some inconveniences but this was beyond that.

Tired and worn out. I realize they are in the midst of renovations but still charging top dollar as if the place is in top form. Dusty dirty furniture unlit exterior towels stored next to the toilet. Not nice. We travel I75 every winter. Will never stay here again. Note to Hilton Hotels. Keep your free breakfast and your Hilton points and keep your hotels from becoming so run down that people do n’t want to sit on the furniture. Very disappointed in a mid range hotel chain. You can do much better than this.

Under Construction but still nice stay. When we drove up we were pretty worried as the lawn had not been mowed and the grounds were in bad shape. There was a big dumpster next to it and when I looked up I could see that rooms were being remodeled. Our room however was nice and clean. The breakfast was very nice and the staff was helpful and courteous. The hotel feels old elevators was old but again our room was nice. It is conveniently located next to Keneland and to many restaurants.

It ’s under construction massive renovation which is fine but the parking and parking lot was a mess the entry way is completely inaccessible and the parking lot is filled with construction materials and equipment. Our room was clearly newly renovated. It was nice and the room was clean. They should have put an exhaust fan in the bathroom because after a hot shower it is unbearably hot and steamy with no fan. Otherwise it was a typical Hampton Inn experience. Staff was friendly.

STAY FAR AWAY. Parking practically non existent service from staff terrible and with attitude plaster pieces from ceilings falling all over our belongings. I never knew ANYONE prior to this trip who had a bad stay at a Hampton and now I know the one I should never have gone to. This has been my worst hotel stay ever.

Worst Hampton Inn ever. I have stayed in Hampton Inns for the past ten years and this was the worst experience I have ever had. The front parking lot was closed off due to restriping and the doors in the rear of the building were locked so that you had to walk around front of the building to enter. The room I stayed in did not have a closed just an area to hang clothes with a curtain in front of it. I went through three remotes before they could get me one that worked. The front desk staff was not helpful and the morning breakfast was bland.

Worst Hampton Inn ever. I have stayed in Hampton Inns for the past ten years and this was the worst experience I have ever had. The front parking lot was closed off due to restriping and the doors in the rear of the building were locked so that you had to walk around front of the building to enter. The room I stayed in did not have a closed just an area to hang clothes with a curtain in front of it. I went through three remotes before they could get me one that worked. The front desk staff was not helpful and the morning breakfast was bland.

Nice Place to Stay with Recent Renovation. We like to stay at Hampton Inns and have done so frequently. The staff was courteous and helpful and the accommodations were very good. The free hot breakfasts were generally nourishing. The housekeeping crew did an excellent job of keeping the rooms clean and equipped. We were traveling with a group of 29 members of a senior choir that was housed for four days during our fall concert tour. The group sale representative Candi Justice was highly helpful during our entire visit.

Overnight stop. Very nice place to stop on my road trip. The room was clean the bed was comfortable the breakfast had a decent selection and the food tasted good and the staff was professional. I have no problem stoping here if it is convienent for me logisticaly.

the people were great but the room and obscene phone calls in the middle of the night disgusting. Location was good breakfast was good. The motel had just had a 5 million renovation so it was painted up and clean. Obscene phone calls at 230 am repeatedly. Our room was the smallest motel room I have ever been in. no closet behind a wall curtain. No vent fan in the bathroom so everything in our room was soggy. one huge orange plastic upholstered chair which was most uncomfortable and almost impossible to sit in. New bed which had the box spring sitting incorrectly so every move on the bed resulted in squeks and growns.

Halfway to Atlanta. This Hampton was 12 way from Detroit area to Atlanta. I knew I could count on a good quality hotel like the Hampton Inn and take advantage of Hilton Honors membership. I do not travel very often so I knew the Hampton Inn would be great quality.

Going north. I reviewed this establishment in December 2018 while traveling. I gave it a fair review but since it was undergoing a renovation I gave it the benefit of the doubt and stated so saying I would give it another chance. Well not much has changed. Room issues stink bugs in the room USB ports not working at all bathroom sink clogged stuff on the walls and dirty shower. The breakfast was no better than last time no breakfast meats no orange juice very disappointing. When I mentioned this to the employee at the desk her response was we are undergoing a renovation and I will award you extra points. NOT GOOD ENOUGH. I travel frequently and always use Hampton Inns being a gold member and want to be a loyal customer. NOT HERE ANYMORE. When I travel through this area again I will be going to the competition.

Staff was great. We had a warm friendly greeting when we had arrived at about 10 PM which is n’t usually a time you get that type of friendly chipper attitude from the front desk and that really helps after a 7 hr. drive late check in. We had the same experience from attendant that helped us at breakfast in the morning and the same attitude when we checked out at noon from another employee. Rooms were great and we had no issues doing our short stay so a wonderful experience all around.
Horrible place hot water ran out in 5 min shower faucet broken AC terrible locks do not work highly recommend you find somewhere else.

3 7 18 I have changed my review over the past few visits. Mike F And ALL of the staff at this location are AMAZING. This is a great location. 8 18 17 UPDATE. I have to take edit my statement about Mike F at the front desk. He was an absolute gentleman this stay and provided EXCELLENT customer service. I have upgraded my rating on this hotel now due to this positive experience. 2 26 2020 UPDATE. This location is still very good. Not sure why they chose the furniture that they did for the rooms. VERY uncomfortable to sit in very long. Chairs do not support your back and cause back pain.
